imageRequirements.title: Artificial Neuron: Brain Cell Analogy
imageRequirements.description:
Illustrate a simplified artificial neuron. Show multiple inputs (x1, x2, x3) with associated weights (w1, w2, w3) feeding into a central circular node. Inside the node, depict a summation symbol (

) combining weighted inputs, followed by an activation function (f). An arrow leaving the node represents the single output. Emphasize the flow from input through processing to output.
imageRequirements.relevanceReasoning: Directly visualizes the fundamental 'brain cell' unit, essential for understanding neural networks. The duration provides initial exposure without overstating its immediate explanation.

imageRequirements.title: Hierarchical Pattern Recognition in DNNs
imageRequirements.description: A diagram showing a multi-layered deep neural network. The input layer receives a simple object image (e.g., a face outline). The first hidden layer extracts basic features (e.g., edges, simple shapes). Subsequent hidden layers combine these to recognize more complex patterns (e.g., eyes, nose, mouth). The output layer identifies the complete object (e.g., 'face'). Use arrows to show data flow and increasing abstraction of features across layers.
imageRequirements.relevanceReasoning: Illustrates how deep networks learn complex representations through layers, directly addressing 'hierarchical pattern recognition'. The duration supports explaining the concept with a multi-layered visual.

imageRequirements.title: Backpropagation Training Workflow
imageRequirements.description: A simplified process flow diagram illustrating the key steps of backpropagation. Start with 'Forward Pass' (data flows through the network to make a prediction). Then 'Calculate Loss' (compare the prediction to the actual target). Then 'Backward Pass' (error gradient flows back through the network layers). Finally, 'Update Weights' (adjust network weights based on the calculated gradients). Use clear arrows to indicate the direction of information flow at each step.
imageRequirements.relevanceReasoning: Visualizes the iterative learning algorithm, 'backpropagation,' which is central to training deep neural networks. The duration accommodates a walkthrough of its key steps.

imageRequirements.title: DL vs. ML: Feature Engineering
imageRequirements.description: A comparison chart or T-chart contrasting traditional Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) regarding feature engineering. For the ML side, show 'Manual Feature Engineering' with an icon representing a person explicitly crafting features. For the DL side, show 'Automatic Feature Extraction' with an icon of a neural network autonomously discovering and learning complex features from raw data. Highlight how DL excels at finding 'sophisticated features'.
imageRequirements.relevanceReasoning: Clearly illustrates deep learning's advantage in automatically extracting advanced features, responding to the mention of 'sophisticated features.' The duration allows for a concise comparison.
